caption:
This photograph features a serene marine scene captured from the perspective of someone aboard a larger boat or ship. The central focus of the image is an older man, likely a fisherman, standing at the stern of the vessel. He is seen from behind, wearing a long-sleeve sweater, suspenders, and a cap, looking out towards the sea. His posture suggests a moment of contemplation or observation.

In the foreground, various maritime objects can be seen: part of the boat's structure including wooden elements, ropes, and metallic parts likely used for anchoring or fishing activities. The sea is calm, reflecting light, and creates a tranquil atmosphere.

In the middle distance, another smaller boat is visible. A person is seated at the stern, actively rowing. This adds a dynamic element to the otherwise peaceful setting.

In the far background, against a hazy sky which might signify either early morning or late afternoon light, a distant lighthouse is discernible on a small island. This not only adds to the nautical theme but also provides a sense of place and navigation.

The composition of this photograph—with its depth from foreground to background, the silhouette of the man, the activity of rowing, and the guiding presence of the lighthouse—evokes a narrative of maritime life and the timeless connection between humans and the sea.
title: Fisherman checks the traps set from April through May. Fish returning to the ocean from their upriver spawning grounds are caught in the nets set at the mouth of the Sakonnet River.
